ARABIC: وَإِنِّى مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌۢ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: I will send them a gift and then wait and see what the messengers bring back.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But I will send them a gift and see what the envoys bring back (in return)."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: I will send them a gift and then see with what answer my envoys return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: I will send a gift and we shall see what response the Messengers will bring."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “And I shall send a present to them, then see what reply the envoys bring.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But verily, I am going to send him a present, and see with what (answer) the messengers return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And surely I am going to send a present to them, and shall wait to see what (answer) do the apostles bring back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Now I will send them a present, and see what the envoys bring back.'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But lo! I am going to send a present unto them, and to see with what (answer) the messengers return.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: but I shall send them a present and see with what reply my envoys will return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So verily I am going to send a present unto them, and see with what answer the envoys come back.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: I will send them a gift, and see what the envoys bring back.’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But I am going to send him a present, and (wait) to see with what (answer) return (my) ambassadors."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But verily! I am going to send him a present, and see with what (answer) the messengers return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: But I shall send them a gift and see what the messengers bring back'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: I am sending them a gift, and will see what the envoys bring back.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But indeed, I will send to them a gift and see with what [reply] the messengers will return."
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [27:35] Now I will send them a gift and wait to see with what [response] the envoys return’, in the way of accepting the gift or rejecting it. If it be a king [to whom we have sent it], he will accept it; but if it be a prophet, he will reject it. Thus, she sent male and female servants, one thousand in total, together with five hundred bricks of gold, a crown studded with jewels, and musk, ambergris and other things with an envoy carrying a letter. The hoopoe thus hurried back to bring the news to Solomon, who ordered bricks of gold and silver to be made and laid out across a [vast] square the distance of nine parasangs from his seat and for a towering wall of gold and silver to be constructed around it, and for the most splendid creatures of the land and the sea, together with the children of the jinn, to be brought to line the right and left sides of the square.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But lo! I am going to send a present unto them) to Solomon, (and to see with what (answer) the messengers return.
